content.question: A student spins a cup that is in contact with a platform in a horizontal circular path at a constant speed, as shown in Figure 1. The platform is connected to two strings that are held by the student as the platform-cup system experiences uniform circular motion. A free-body diagram of the cup is shown in Figure 2. Which statement of reasoning best supports and correctly identifies the magnitude of the force the cup exerts on the platform?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because this force represents the magnitude of the force of friction between the cup and the platform.

<math alttext="F sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, because this force represents the magnitude of the normal force exerted on the cup by the platform.

<math alttext="the square root of, F sub 1 squared, plus, F sub 2 squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>, because this force represents the magnitude of the total force exerted on the platform by the cup.

<math alttext="the square root of, F sub 1 squared, plus, F sub 2 squared, plus F sub 3 squared" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>, because this represents the magnitude of the net force exerted on the cup.

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of, F sub 1 squared, plus, F sub 2 squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>, because this force represents the magnitude of the total force exerted on the platform by the cup.
